intro: Lecanocarpus aristata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are woody and can become quite branched. Lecanocarpus aristata is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
